dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 7616 IH: To reduce the amount made available to the National Archives and Records Administration unless certain backlogs of the Administration are resolved, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Bentz (for himself, Mr. Carter of Georgia, Mrs. Rodgers of Washington, Mr. Bucshon, Mr. Gosar, Mr. Tiffany, Mr. Budd, Mr. Posey, Ms. Mace, Ms. Malliotakis, Mrs. Wagner, Mr. Mast, Ms. Herrell, Mr. Gaetz, and Mr. Fulcher) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform

form.official-title: To reduce the amount made available to the National Archives and Records Administration unless certain backlogs of the Administration are resolved, and for other purposes.

section.header: Amounts made available to the National Archives and Records Administration
section.text: Amounts made available to the National Archives and Records Administration for personnel records processing for fiscal year 2023, and each fiscal year thereafter, shall be reduced to the amount available for obligation or expenditure on March 20, 2020, for that purpose, unless the Administration processes and resolves before October 1, 2022, the personnel records backlog of 600,000 requests.
